snippet: Anjelica Castillo lived with seven people in a Queens apartment, but none spoke up when she vanished; neither did her parents, sisters or the cabdriver who reportedly ferried her killer.
abstract: Baby Hope, now identified as Anjelica Castillo, lived with seven people in Queens apartment where she was killed in 1991, but none, including her parents, spoke up when she vanished; law enforcement officials say the immigration status of many of the child's family members may have played a role in their silence.

byline.contributor: William K. Rashbaum, Rebecca White and Vivian Yee contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Anjelica Castillo lived with seven people in a Queens apartment, but none spoke up when she vanished; neither did her parents, sisters or the cabdriver who reportedly ferried her killer.

headline.main: As Police Chased Leads About ‘Baby Hope,’ Those Who Knew Her Kept Quiet
headline.print_headline: As Police Chased Leads About ‘Baby Hope,’ Those Who Knew Her Kept Quiet
